abstract: Republicans spurn proposals made by Pres Obama during his State of Union address, blaming him for alleged unwillingness to work with them to pass bipartisan legislation.
lead_paragraph: Republicans rejected most of the proposals in President Obama’s State of the Union address, saying he is unwilling to compromise.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and EMMARIE HUETTEMAN

snippet: Republicans rejected most of the proposals in President Obama’s State of the Union address, saying he is unwilling to compromise.

headline.main: Republicans Have One Word for President’s Proposals and Veto Threats: ‘No’
headline.print_headline: Republicans Have One Word for President’s Proposals and Veto Threats: ‘No’
